content.title: Tibial/Pedal Artery Access
content.description: Retrograde access via tibiopedal arteries (anterior tibial, posterior tibial, peroneal, or dorsalis pedis) for complex infrainguinal interventions.
content.SAFARI_technique: Subintimal Arterial Flossing with Antegrade-Retrograde Intervention - meeting wires in CTO to establish through-and-through access
content.statement: Tibial/Pedal Artery Access is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Tibial/Pedal Artery Access helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Tibial/Pedal Artery Access include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Tibial/Pedal Artery Access.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Tibial/Pedal Artery Access. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
